data.title: Companies House – We use our blog to talk about the work we’re doing, offering tips and advice on starting, running and closing a company. We also share the latest developments on the changes to UK co
data.meta_description: We use our blog to talk about the work we’re doing, offering tips and advice on starting, running and closing a company. We also share the latest developments on the changes to UK company law.
data.text:
Companies House Campus: sharing user-centred thinking across the organisation

Posted by: Alkistis Geropoulou - Head of User-Centred Design, Posted on: - Categories: Working at Companies House

Companies House Campus is an education hub designed to help colleagues gain a better understanding of user needs. Find out how it's adding value.

Read more of Companies House Campus: sharing user-centred thinking across the organisation

From retail to Rising Star: how I built a fulfilling career in the Civil Service

Learn about what it's like to build a career at Companies House. Patrick Gilligan shares his experience, from getting started in the Civil Service to winning a Rising Star award at last year's Civil Service Awards.

Read more of From retail to Rising Star: how I built a fulfilling career in the Civil Service

Build your career at Companies House

Posted by: Katie Jones - Recruitment Manager, Posted on: - Categories: Working at Companies House

Have you ever wondered what it's like to work for Companies House? We've developed a new careers hub to help you understand the type of career you can build here.

Read more of Build your career at Companies House - 4 comments

Improving the accuracy of the Companies House register

We'll soon start to use our new and enhanced powers to query information and request supporting evidence. Over time this will lead to more accurate and trusted information on the register.

Read more of Improving the accuracy of the Companies House register - 6 comments

Get ready for changes to UK company law

We’re aiming to introduce the first set of changes brought in by the Economic Crime and Corporate Transparency Act on 4 March 2024. Here’s what you need to know.

Read more of Get ready for changes to UK company law - 100 comments

A new year and a new challenge for Companies House

Louise Smyth, Registrar of Companies for England and Wales, reflects on her highlights from 2023 and shares more information about what 2024 will look like for Companies House.

Read more of A new year and a new challenge for Companies House - 9 comments

Filing your Register of Overseas Entities update statement

All overseas entities on the Register of Overseas Entities must file an update statement every year. Read practical tips to help you file your statement.

Read more of Filing your Register of Overseas Entities update statement

Changes to UK company law: a big moment for Companies House

The Economic Crime and Corporate Transparency Bill has become law. Find out what this means for you and your company so that you can take action at the right time.

Read more of Changes to UK company law: a big moment for Companies House - 35 comments

Working as a lead technical architect at Companies House

Posted by: Michael Moore - Lead Technical Architect, Posted on: - Categories: Working at Companies House

Mike works as a lead technical architect at Companies House. Read on to find out what he likes most about the role.

Read more of Working as a lead technical architect at Companies House
